title: Inside Europe 21.07.22
description: Climate change brings more extreme weather to Europe, Hungary's tax reforms spark public protests, and Paris hopes to stage the 2024 Olympics without blowing the budget. Also: newcomers to Italy build their culinary confidence, the threat to Europe from the new Centaurus COVID variant, and the campaign to give the UK's Cornwall county more powers.
itunes:author: DW.COM | Deutsche Welle
itunes:keywords: Nik Martin, Inside Europe, climate change, European heat wave, Hungary rule of law, press freedom, Turkey, 2024 Paris Olympics, Cornwall, autonomy, Italy migrants, centaurus variant, COVID-19
